text:
The Justice AP Shah Panel submitted to the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, a report that found that gas has migrated between Oil and Natural Gas Corporation’s and Reliance Industries Ltd.’s adjacent oil fields in the Krishna-Godavari basin. Justice Shah today submitted a comprehensive report on the gas migration issue, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said in New Delhi. Pradhan said the one man committee has also submitted observations from  the DeGoyler and MacNaughton report that showed how the fields managed by the two companies share the same reservoir.The report has found that gas migrated from ONGC’s fields to RIL’s, the Oil Minister confirmed. The ministry  “will take appropriate action” based on the findings of the report, Pradhan said in a post on microblogging site Twitter.





Received report from Justice A P Shah on ONGC-Reliance dispute on gas migration in KG;will take appropriate action pic.twitter.com/lzKCl0IaYi— Dharmendra Pradhan (@dpradhanbjp) August 31, 2016
title: AP Shah Panel Report Confirms Gas Migration Between ONGC And RIL
